title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 May 2016 - XWiki
content:

09:37 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <DarkKnightCZ> Hi, I'm trying the XWikiTube application and after the initial struggles with horribly slow vp9 encoding I've encountered issues with rendering html content with exception "When using the HTML macro inline, you can only use inline HTML content. Block HTML content (such as tables) cannot be displayed. Try leaving an empty line before and after the HTML macro". Apparently it seams html macro cannot render video tag. Are there any known issues  
09:44 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <evalica> has quit  
09:59 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <ujjwal> has quit  
10:43 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <vmassol1> if the ci doesn't break anywhere with all those upgrades that'll be a miracle ;)  
11:17 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <tmortagne> vmassol1: you are just mean :P  
11:31 <vmassol1> :)  
11:31 <vmassol1> realistic?  
11:31 <vmassol1> pragramtic?  
11:31 <vmassol1> \*pragmatic  
11:33 <mflorea> vmassol1, afaik we don't support table caption in wiki syntax, right? https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/HTML/Element/caption  
11:33 <mflorea> nothing mentioned here http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax?syntax=2.1&section=Tables  
11:34 <mflorea> about caption  
11:36 <vmassol1> mflorea: correct, I don't think we support it. Just searched for "caption" in the xhtml renderer and couldn't find it  
11:36 <mflorea> ok, thanks, I'll have to disable/hide this feature from the CKEditor for now then  
11:36 <mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/CKEDITOR-74  
11:37 <vmassol1> indeed too bad…  
11:42 <ujjwal\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <woshilapin> has quit  
11:44 <ujjwal> has quit  
11:57 <ujjwal\_> has quit  
12:19 <tmortagne> mflorea, vmassol1: I guess we could have a first version based on table parameter which would support only plain text  
12:19 <tmortagne> as in (%caption="Some title"%)  
12:19 <tmortagne> fully support caption require a new event  
12:20 <vmassol1> haven't read about caption yet but yes if css can support it partially maybe the wysiwyg could use it (if not too much work)  
12:20 <vmassol1> or use html to support it...  
12:20 <tmortagne> not css  
12:20 <vmassol1> html macro that is  
12:20 <vmassol1> but not very nice ;)  
12:20 <vmassol1> yes sorry not css  
12:20 <tmortagne> I mean make the html renderer convert this parameter into <caption>  
12:20 <vmassol1> html attributes  
12:20 <vmassol1> ah  
12:21 <vmassol1> ok got it  
12:21 <vmassol1> hmm I think I'd prfer to add full support for caption seems to be about the same amount of work  
12:21 <vmassol1> not same, similar  
12:21 <tmortagne> not really  
12:21 <tmortagne> you also need a syntax on XWiki syntax side  
12:21 <tmortagne> and render/parser for it  
12:21 <vmassol1> right  
12:22 <vmassol1> FTR md supports it I think: http://fletcher.github.io/MultiMarkdown-5/tables.html  
12:34 <vmassol1> evalica: seems we lost the panels on xwiki.org  
12:34 <evalica> ?  
12:35 <evalica> where?  
12:35 <vmassol1> any pagz  
12:35 <vmassol1> for ex: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Supporters/#HCompaniessponsoringdevelopment  
12:35 <vmassol1> (main wiki)  
12:35 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
12:35 <evalica> ok so Main space - let me check  
12:35 <evalica> Roadmap ois fine  
12:36 <evalica> vmassol: fixed - sorry - probably from an import yesterday  
12:36 <vmassol> ok  
12:38 <evalica> vmassol: let me know when you finish with footer  
12:38 <vmassol> not touching it  
12:38 <vmassol> done  
12:38 <evalica> it's locked - ty  
12:38 <vmassol> not anymore  
12:49 <acotiuga\_> has joined #xwiki

13:28 <Denis> has quit  
13:28 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki

13:35 <M-okxjd> has joined #xwiki

13:41 <acotiuga\_> Could anyone take a look on this fail: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/Contrib%20-%20Forum%20Application/lastBuild/console ?  It says Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0 and then  
13:41 <acotiuga\_> [ERROR] java.lang.AssertionError: [ERROR] There should be no content output to the console by the test!  
13:46 <acotiuga\_> Looks like the output is generated all the time and maybe one of the errors fail the build, but not all of them  
14:25 <vmassol> Enygma`: I don't like the tutorial category for the blog  
14:25 <vmassol> I don't think blog should be about tutorials  
14:25 <vmassol> for me we need to move tutorials in the doc proper  
14:25 <vmassol> and have the blog post link to them  
14:25 <vmassol> (or include them using the include macro if you prefer)  
14:26 <vmassol> because blog post are visible only during a given time; they're timestamped news  
14:26 <vmassol> while tutorial are meant to be long-lived  
14:26 <vmassol> wdyt?  
14:26 <vmassol> so this HTTP/REST tutorial would be useful on the REST doc page  
14:27 <vmassol> (as a link there to a tutorial page)  
14:27 <vmassol> offtopic: btw full links should be avoided too since they don't support renames  
14:28 <vmassol> and external tutorials needs to be linked  
14:28 <vmassol> for example from http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ExternalLinks  
14:28 <vmassol> adding fabio's blog post  
14:28 <vmassol> actually I had already added it ;)  
14:28 <vmassol> lol  
14:56 <vmassol> guys  
14:56 <vmassol> going to drop and recreate playground  
14:56 <vmassol> let's hope xwiki.org doesn't go down this time…  
15:03 <maya\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:03 <Enygma`> vmassol: fixed the link  
15:03 <Enygma`> re tutorials, I have mixed feelings  
15:03 <maya\_\_> Hi  
15:03 <Enygma`> blog articles are not really one-time news (like activity stream), they are indexed by google and they show up  
15:04 <vmassol> sure but you don't find them otherwise  
15:04 <Enygma`> we can link to them from the feature page  
15:04 <Enygma`> the advantage of a blog article is social interaction  
15:11 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:11 <vmassol> xwiki.org is back  
15:18 <evalica> maya\_\_: if you don't find a person to help on IRC, you can send a mail to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) maybe you'll have more luck there.  
15:18 <maya\_\_> Ok thanks evalica  
15:19 <vmassol> maya\_\_: check that the postgre sql sriver is in WEB-INF/lib  
15:19 <vmassol> \*driver  
15:21 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <Enygma`> has quit  
15:25 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <vmassol> has quit  
15:30 <boubou> I deploy the new version in my tomcat  
15:30 <boubou> Path Version Display Name Running Sessions Commands  
15:30 <boubou> ./ None specified  
15:31 <boubou> strange  
15:31 <boubou> It worked perfectly with 8.0  
15:32 <boubou> I deployed the xwiki-entreprise-web8.1 from .war file in  /var/lib/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/  
15:36 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
15:37 <maya\_\_> Thanks vmassol1, it work now...but...Upgrade wizard does not appear :(  
15:44 <vmassol1> maya\_\_: make sure your permanent direcdtory is still there as before the upgrade  
15:44 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
15:48 <OSIMasson> has left #xwiki  
15:53 <ujjwal\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <ujjwal\_> has quit  
16:02 <ujjwal\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:17 <maya\_\_> Thanks vmassol  
16:18 <maya\_\_> Buyt now, I have this error : Could not load conf for core xwiki: Error loading solr config from /var/lib/xwiki/data/solr/xwiki/conf/solrconfig.xml  
16:18 <maya\_\_> Permissions are ok  
16:20 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:23 <tmortagne> maya\_\_: do you have an empty /var/lib/xwiki/data/solr/ folder ?  
16:24 <maya\_\_> tmortagne, I can  
16:24 <tmortagne> I'm not asking you to empty it  
16:24 <tmortagne> I'm asking if it's empty :)  
16:24 <tmortagne> usually this error come from the fact that /var/lib/xwiki/data/solr/ exist but is invalid  
16:24 <maya\_\_> tmortagne, no it's not  
16:25 <tmortagne> in which case you should completely delete it so that it's recreated  
16:25 <tmortagne> but stop XWiki first  
16:25 <tmortagne> i.e. stop tomcat, delete that folder, start tomcat  
16:25 <samo> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <samo> hi  
16:25 <tmortagne> XWiki will automatically start reindexing at startup  
16:26 <samo> is now known as <Guest91715>  
16:26 <Guest91715> can I install xwiki on a server & mysql on another server ?  
16:27 <vmassol> Guest91715: sure it's even recommended  
16:27 <Guest91715> great  
16:27 <vmassol> by xwiki I think you mean the servlet container  
16:27 <Guest91715> so how do I connect them ?  
16:27 <Guest91715> yep  
16:27 <vmassol> an ip/hostname  
16:27 <vmassol> in hibernate.cfg.xml  
16:27 <vmassol> gtg meeting  
16:27 <vmassol> ..  
16:27 <Guest91715> I did that  
16:27 <Guest91715> but I get  
16:28 <Guest91715> java.sql.SQLException: No suitable driver  
16:28 <Guest91715> I downloaded the jdbc  
16:28 <Guest91715> & put it in the WEB-INFO/lib  
16:29 <Guest91715> still the same error  
16:30 <tmortagne> Guest91715: did you restarted ?  
16:30 <Guest91715> I commented bind\_address in my.cnf  
16:30 <Guest91715> yeah sure  
16:30 <Guest91715> I added the hostnames to /etc/hosts  
16:30 <tmortagne> "No suitable driver" means it cannot find the driver you declared in hibernate conf in WEB-INF/lib basically so it's not a server side issue  
16:32 <tmortagne> actually not in WEB-INF/lin  
16:32 <tmortagne> it cannot find the hibernate driver, not the connector if the error message is accurate  
16:32 <tmortagne> what do you have for <property name="connection.driver\_class"> property ?  
16:33 <Guest91715>  <property name="connection.driver\_class">com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</property>  
16:34 <tmortagne> looks right  
16:34 <tmortagne> very weird  
16:35 <tmortagne> could you put the complete error in something like pastebin ?  
16:35 <Guest91715> ok  
16:36 <Guest91715> http://pastebin.com/2GFnJx7v  
16:36 <boubou> tmortagne how are u ?  
16:37 <Guest91715> I red when I get something like that, it's usually the last error  
16:38 <tmortagne> the error definitely means that hibernate cannot find com.mysql.jdbc.Driver class and that driver is supposed to be in the connector  
16:38 <tmortagne> you sure you have mysql connector in WEB-INF/lib ?  
16:38 <Guest91715> yep, very sure  
16:38 <boubou> I decided to manually deploy the new 8.1 war file in /var/lib/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/  
16:39 <boubou> but it doesnt look to work  
16:39 <tmortagne> well except for a broken connector I don't have much idea, maybe try to open the jar and see if the class is there  
16:39 <boubou> does it have something special to do ?  
16:39 <Guest91715> here /webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/mysql-connector-java-5.1.39-bin.jar  
16:39 <tmortagne> boubou: make sure you are using Java 8, seems to be the commons mistake there days  
16:39 <tmortagne> Guest91715: yes this jar  
16:40 <tmortagne> make sure the file permission are ok too  
16:40 <tmortagne> s/there days/theses days/  
16:40 <Guest91715> 664  
16:40 <tmortagne> looks right indeed, so if the class in in that jar I really don't have a clue  
16:41 <tmortagne> you can open it as a zip and see if you find com/mysql/jdbc/Driver.class  file  
16:41 <Guest91715> I downloaded it last week from the official site  
16:41 <tmortagne> maybe there was a network issue or something  
16:41 <Guest91715> about that  
16:41 <Guest91715> I downloaded a zip  
16:42 <Guest91715> but I only copied the JAR  file in that directory  
16:42 <Guest91715> is it right ?  
16:42 <tmortagne> yes you don't need more  
16:44 <tmortagne> another possibility is to use the one provided by your linux distro repositories  
16:44 <tmortagne> on Debian based distribution it's libmysql-java package  
16:45 <tmortagne> and the jar end up in /usr/share/java/mysql.jar  
16:46 <tmortagne> but if you are on Debian (or Ubuntu) you should probably use XWiki Debian packages  
16:46 <tmortagne> makes things much easier  
16:47 <Guest91715> I'm ubuntu  
16:47 <tmortagne> you can look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT for more details about Debian packages  
16:48 <Guest91715> I'm using puppet to install this  
16:48 <tmortagne> ok  
16:48 <Guest91715> when I tried it on the same server it worked in a flash  
16:49 <boubou> tmortagne http://imgur.com/ejT0zAe  
16:49 <boubou> http://pastebin.com/ezuB7aE3  
16:49 <boubou> perms are 755  
16:50 <tmortagne> boubou: what is import is what runs Tomcat, try "ps aux | grep tomcat"  
16:50 <tmortagne> if the issue is not related to the version of Java then you will need to produce more information than "it doesnt look to work"  
16:50 <tmortagne> s/produce/provide/  
16:50 <boubou> ps aux | grep tomcat  
16:50 <boubou> root      2208  0.0  0.0 112636   984 pts/0    S+   10:50   0:00 grep --color=auto tomcat  
16:51 <tmortagne> what do you get with "java --version"  
16:51 <tmortagne> ?  
16:52 <boubou> http://pastebin.com/bWsjPPXK  
16:52 <boubou> do I need a JRE or JDK  
16:52 <boubou> JDK include JRE ?  
16:52 <tmortagne> if /usr/lib/jvm/ is the default JVM then I guess it's ok  
16:53 <tmortagne> JRE is enough  
16:53 <tmortagne> JDK include JRE yes as you can see from the path  
16:53 <boubou> yes  
16:53 <boubou> tmortagne http://imgur.com/ejT0zAe  
16:53 <boubou> looks strange  
16:53 <boubou> why its unspecified ?  
16:54 <tmortagne> I have no idea what this means, never used this UI  
16:54 <tmortagne> next step is to look at tomcat log  
16:54 <tmortagne> see if you have any XWiki related error in there  
16:54 <Guest91715> is this OK ? <property name="connection.url">jdbc:mysql://192.168.58.190/xwiki</property>  
16:55 <tmortagne> Guest91715: yes it looks ok but either the hibernate is totally missleading or your issue is with the driver  
16:55 <tmortagne> s/the hiernate/the hibernate error/  
16:55 <Guest91715> .190 is the mysql ip  
16:55 <tmortagne> it does not seems to even try to connect  
16:56 <tmortagne> since it cannot load the driver that is supposed to do that connection  
16:56 <Guest91715> where is the driver called ?  
16:56 <boubou> there is no tomcat.log  
16:56 <boubou> :(  
16:57 <ujjwal\_> has quit  
16:57 <tmortagne> the "driver" is what hibernate call the connector  
16:57 <tmortagne> did you openned the jar as I suggected ?  
16:57 <tmortagne> \*suggested  
16:58 <Guest91715> no, I used "cat" & my machine crashed  
16:58 <Guest91715> how to open it with unzip ?  
16:58 <tmortagne> well you just do :) this is a zip file than happen to have a name ending with ".jar"  
16:59 <ujjwal\_> has joined #xwiki  
17:03 <Guest91715> yep  
17:03 <Guest91715> there is a Driver.class  
17:04 <tmortagne> if right is ok and connector is ok I really don't have a clue, you sure you don't have several XWiki instances in your server ?  
17:04 <Guest91715> no, I downloaded the .war & expanded it  
17:04 <Guest91715> nothing more  
17:05 <tmortagne> Guest91715: you might want to reset all that and try the standard Debian packages, maybe you will have more luck  
17:05 <tmortagne> (on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT)  
17:05 <ujjwal\_> has quit  
17:05 <tmortagne> are you using Java 8 by the way ?  
17:06 <Guest91715> yeah, of course  
17:06 <Guest91715> java version "1.8.0\_91"  
17:06 <tmortagne> ok looks good  
17:07 <Guest91715> I can't use the standard packages  
17:07 <Guest91715> well, does it install mysql together with xwiki & tomcat  
17:07 <Guest91715> ?  
17:11 <tmortagne> hmm the xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-mysql yes but you can install xwiki-enterprise-tomcat-common but it's not going to help much with the mysql setup indeed  
17:11 <tmortagne> I guess something you could do is install xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-mysql to get proper setup and driver and then get rid of mysql server (which will uninstall  xwiki-enterprise-tomcat7-mysql package but should not touch configuration files I think if you don't use --purge)  
17:12 <tmortagne> then you will just need to modify the host in the hibernate conf I guess  
17:13 <boubou> tmortagne if I deploy the 8.0 war file, I have NO ISSUE  
17:13 <boubou> it looks like there is something wrong somewhere  
17:13 <tmortagne> boubou: sure but I can't really help you without more information  
17:14 <boubou> I would like to give you more info but HOW ?  
17:14 <Guest91715> seems legit, maybe I will try that on a different CT & only keep the hibernate & the connector  
17:14 <boubou> which log should show me the error ?  
17:14 <tmortagne> boubou: you need to get tomcat log, I can't tell you for your system but on Debian it's on /var/log/tomcat7/catalina.out  
17:14 <Guest91715> Boubou, you are connecting to xwiki through 127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki  
17:14 <Guest91715> right ?  
17:14 <tmortagne> you should probably search for catalina.out in all your system  
17:17 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
17:17 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
17:18 <Guest91715> morgane  
17:18 <Guest91715> are those the only one's I should keep ?  
17:19 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
17:20 <tmortagne> Guest91715: should be, but note that the connector is installed in /usr/share/java/mysql.jar and then linked from XWiki webapp  
17:21 <mflorea> has quit  
17:21 <tmortagne> so what you need to keep is just the link if you keep installing libmysql-java package package  
17:21 <Guest91715> so I will just have to copy & rename it !  
17:22 <tmortagne> what Ubuntu is this ? 14.04 ?  
17:22 <Guest91715> yes  
17:22 <tmortagne> ok so same as the server I upgrade to 8.1 2 hours ago  
17:22 <tmortagne> only difference with you is that I'm lazy and keep MySQL on the same server :)  
17:23 <Guest91715> lol, I'm obliged & not by choice :p  
17:25 <acotiuga\_> has quit  
17:25 <boubou> tmortagne here I have ur info  
17:25 <boubou> http://pastebin.com/T0Kfa7MS  
17:26 <boubou> on centos, catalina.out isd located in /var/log/tomcat  
17:26 <boubou> I dont get these issues with 8.0 version  
17:27 <tmortagne> boubou: it's the same version of Tomcat ?  
17:27 <boubou> yes  
17:27 <boubou> installed with yum  
17:27 <tmortagne> what you get is a Tomcat error  
17:28 <tmortagne> make sure you gave the right permission to xwiki webapp  
17:28 <tmortagne> Tomcat complains about jar it cannot parse (pretty much all XWiki jars)  
17:29 <tmortagne> "SEVERE: Unable to process Jar entry [org/xwiki/component/script/ComponentScriptService.class] from Jar [jar:file:/usr/share/tomcat/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-platform-component-script-8.1.jar!/] for annotations"  
17:29 <tmortagne> hmm it's not permission issue since it was able to open the jar  
17:29 <boubou> drwxr-xr-x 7 tomcat tomcat 94 May 25 11:20 ROOT  
17:29 <tmortagne> If you really did not changed anything in Tomcat I don't have much idea, it should not try to find annotations in the first place  
17:30 <boubou> no  
17:30 <boubou> I use it as a vm  
17:30 <boubou> I installed the 8.0 war file, it worked
